Bravo, Daniel, I think you've nailed it. One thing: I
don't think more than 5 scenarios should be
NPC-protecting levels. Frankly, they're a pain in the
ass, and it's extraordinarily frustrating to play them
on Slaughter. It's not thematic, either... a party of
refugees traveling through hostile territory would
have to expect to take heavy losses. And if you're
with them, then how would it make sense for the death
of your fighters to be okay while the death of a
single non-combatant was unacceptable? Screwy. Anyway,
we'll need to agree on a few things: difficulty, of
course. Will this be a "from scratch" thing, as in
something you start with a brand-new team? How large
should the maps be? My preference, of course, is for
really large maps, but not everyone will want to spend
their time creating non-necessary space. Comments?

My version of Gladiator is becoming increasingly
unstable. These days I can usually only play a stage
or two and then it crashes. I assume this is because
of all the .fss and .pix files in my Glad directory...
the program has to load all of them. I'm thinking that
perhaps, once I'm absolutely sure I like the way the
TevFifty are, and everyone else puts out a finished
version of their levels, I'll pull all the files out
of the included .001 files and re-pack it all, with
the new stuff. Just a thought.
    -T.
